parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.70

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Vehicle Loadouts

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value>Return array of magazines on pylons

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''getPylonMagazines''' vehicle

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> vehicle: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] of [[String]]s (magazine classnames)

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[getPylonMagazines]] ([[vehicle]] [[player]]) </code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[Arma 3 Vehicle Loadouts]],[[getCompatiblePylonMagazines]],[[setAmmoOnPylon]],[[ammoOnPylon]],[[animatePylon]],[[animateBay]],[[setPylonsPriority]],[[setPylonLoadout]],[[magazinesAllTurrets]]
</value></part></template>


<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on May 12, 2017 - 19:58 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:AgentRevolution|AgentRev]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
The indexes of the returned array's elements are relative to the pylon indexes, such that element 0 is pylon 1, element 1 is pylon 2, etc.
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
